intro: Chrysostemon virgatus, commonly known as the silverleaf chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shrub form, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
